title: Derby captain Richard Keogh told to take pay cut on £1.3m wages or be sacked
text:
Derby captain Richard Keogh has been ordered to take a cut in wages if he is to stay at Pride Park.

The defender sustained serious injuries at the end of a team-bonding night last month, suffering knee ligament damage that is likely to keep him on the sidelines for more than a year.

Keogh, 34, was in the back seat of Tom Lawrence’s car when it crashed into a lamp post after the night out on September 24.

Richard Keogh has been given an ultimatum by Derby as he fights for his future at the club

Keogh was in the back of a black Range Rover last month while it was involved in a car crash

Lawrence, the Wales forward, and team-mate Mason Bennett were fined, banned from driving for two years and ordered to carry out 180 hours of unpaid for their part in the car crash, which happened on the A6.

The pair appeared in court on October 15 after being charged with drink driving. Derby also fined Lawrence and Bennett six weeks’ wages each.

According to a report in The Telegraph, Keogh faces being sacked for gross misconduct if he chooses not to accept a reduction to his £1.3million annual salary.

Keogh has been ruled out until December 2020 after being involved in the horror car crash

Derby forward Tom Lawrence was driving the Range Rover that had Keogh in the back

A Derby spokesman said: ‘The process is ongoing and in order not to prejudice any of that process we will not be making any comment until the conclusion of our investigation.’

Players had been drinking in the Joiners Arms in the Quarndon area of Derby before the crash.

Lawrence and Bennett were restored to the first-team squad soon afterwards, with Lawrence also keeping his place in Ryan Giggs’ international squad.
